results.title: In Turkey, a Watery Grave Becomes a Park
results.abstract: Off the Gallipoli Peninsula, the remains of some two dozen British, French and Australian ships — World War I relics — are memorialized in an undersea park formed during the pandemic.

multimedia.caption: The HMS Majestic, a 421-foot battleship commissioned at Portsmouth, England, in 1895, is the first wreck that will be accessible to tourists. A German U-21 submarine torpedoed and sank the Majestic on May 27, 1915, with a loss of 49 sailors.
multimedia.copyright: Ali Keskin

results.title: To Avoid River Flooding, Go With the Flow, the Dutch Say
results.abstract: Extreme rainfall is causing deadly and destructive floods globally. The Netherlands averted disaster this summer by creating flood plains.

multimedia.caption: A farmland scene in the Netherlands, a country that has faced sea-level rise and river floods long before climate change became a worry.
multimedia.copyright: Ilvy Njiokiktjien for The New York Times

results.title: Inflation Is Popping From Sydney to San Francisco. It May Be a Good Sign.
results.abstract: Inflation has surged across advanced economies. The shared experience underlines that price gains come from temporary drivers — for now.

multimedia.caption: Shoppers in New York City last month. The current trend in rising prices ties back to disruptions caused by lockdowns and subsequent reopenings.
multimedia.copyright: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times
